Please email idcenter@uic.edu for assistance determining if your issue is considered emergent.      The State Carding Office has recommended that all ID Centers adhere to these policies during the stay-at-home order:      Normal card operations are suspended until the University deems it is safe to return to normal operating hours;  New IDs will be issued on a case-by-case basis, if there is an emergency situation supporting the request;  Replacement IDs will be issued on a case-by-case basis if there is an emergency situation supporting the request;  Cards with expiration dates in March or April 2020 have had expiration dates extended thru the end of May, and could be extended longer if the stay-at-home order extends;   Lost IDs will be replaced if there was an emergency supporting the request.      The ID Center will work with each case-by-case request to identify if the request is emergent, and will recommend other options that may produce the same outcome (with regard to door access the use of a “Departmental Card”, or for Parking which has shifted some lots to not require a card for entry).      We are working with CTA to clarify and plan for the continuity of the UPASS program for the remainder of the semester, and subsequent periods.     Our Mission The mission of the ID Center is to support the university community with a standardized and convenient form of identification. The ID Center strives to equip the card as a means to provide access to related university systems and services. A dedicated staff is committed to serving all customers in an efficient and courteous manner. The ID Center will endeavor to bring expanded uses of the card through advances in technology and innovation.  What we do The ID Center provides a one-stop shop for university students‚ faculty‚ staff and visitors identification card needs. We directly support the production of i-cards‚ visitor cards‚ the Dragon Dollar$ program‚ the CTA U-Pass program‚ and provide assistance with all facets of using your university issued ID on campus.  Our satellite ID Center on the west campus supports the medical & professional community with ID creation services close to their offices and classrooms.        Contact Information for Main ID Center           CTA U-PASS  Your U-Pass provides you unlimited rides on the CTA during your enrollment as a full-time student at the University.             Identification Cards  Your i-card is your official permanent ID card and will be used as long as you attend or are employed by the University.             Dragon Dollar$  The Dragon Dollar$ program is the official campus debit account linked to your i-card.            Locations       Main ID Center  Satellite ID Center      750 S.
